name: gin
description: Gin is a distilled liquor that gets its flavor from juniper berries.

name: vodka
description: Vodka is a clear distilled liquor from Europe with a neutral flavor.

name: whiskey
description: Whiskey is a distilled liquor made from grain mash.

name: tequilla
description: Tequila is a Mexican distilled spirit made from a specific type of agave: the blue agave plant, or agave tequiliana

name: rum
description: Rum is a distilled liquor made from sugarcane molasses or juice. Styles of rum include white rum, golden rum, dark rum, and aged rum.

name: brandy
description: Brandy, alcoholic beverage distilled from wine or a fermented fruit mash. The term used alone generally refers to the grape product; brandies made from the wines or fermented mashes of other fruits are commonly identified by the specific fruit name.

name: absienthe
description: Absinthe is a green anise-flavored spirit made from distilling alcohol with botanicals like wormwood, anise, fennel and other herbs.

name: amaretto
description: Amaretto is an Italian almond-flavored liqueur invented in 1851.

name: amaro
description: Amaro or amari is a family of Italian herbal liqueurs that taste bitter (amaro means bitter in Italian)

name: aperol
description: Aperol is a sweet Italian liqueur (amaro) with a citrus flavor.

name: campari
description: Campari is a popular bright red Italian amaro invented in the 1860s with a very bitter flavor.

name: gin2
description: Gin is a distilled liquor that gets its flavor from juniper berries.

name: vodka2
description: Vodka is a clear distilled liquor from Europe with a neutral flavor.

name: whiskey2
description: Whiskey is a distilled liquor made from grain mash.

name: tequilla2
description: Tequila is a Mexican distilled spirit made from a specific type of agave: the blue agave plant, or agave tequiliana

name: rum2
description: Rum is a distilled liquor made from sugarcane molasses or juice. Styles of rum include white rum, golden rum, dark rum, and aged rum.

name: brandy2
description: Brandy, alcoholic beverage distilled from wine or a fermented fruit mash. The term used alone generally refers to the grape product; brandies made from the wines or fermented mashes of other fruits are commonly identified by the specific fruit name.

name: absienthe2
description: Absinthe is a green anise-flavored spirit made from distilling alcohol with botanicals like wormwood, anise, fennel and other herbs.

name: amaretto2
description: Amaretto is an Italian almond-flavored liqueur invented in 1851.

name: amaro2
description: Amaro or amari is a family of Italian herbal liqueurs that taste bitter (amaro means bitter in Italian).

name: aperol2
description: Aperol is a sweet Italian liqueur (amaro) with a citrus flavor.

name: campari2
description: Campari is a popular bright red Italian amaro invented in the 1860s with a very bitter flavor.

name: forthifield wine2
description: Fortified wine is a type of alcohol that adds a distilled spirit (usually brandy) to a wine to stabilize it.

name: lillet2
description: Lillet (pronounced lee-LAY) is a French aromatized aperitif wine made with a blend of Bordeaux grapes and fortified with a blend of citrus liqueurs.

name: madaira2
description: Madeira is a fortified wine made on the Portuguese islands of Madeira, produced in a range of styles from bone dry to sticky sweet.

name: sherry2
description: Sherry is a fortified wine from the Jerez region of Spain, where the primary grape is Palomino.

name: vermuth2
description: Vermouth is an aromatized wine that includes wine, botanicals, some sugar (or grape juice) and spirits to fortify the wine.

name: ales2
description: Ale is a type of beer brewed using a warm fermentation method, resulting in a sweet, full-bodied and fruity taste.

name: weath2
description: Wheat is whiskey is type of distilled alcoholic beverage, generally made from fermented grain mash including barley, corn, rye, and wheat.

name: porter2
description: Porter is a style of beer that was developed in London, England in the early 18th century. It was well-hopped and dark in appearance owing to the use of brown malt.

name: pilsner2
description: Pilsner is brewed with pilsner malt and lager yeast, which is bottom-fermenting and distinguishes lagers from ales.

name: stout2
description: stout contains nearly twice the amount of antioxidants found in light-coloured lagers. Stout is packed with flavonoids, the antioxidants that give fruit and vegetables their dark colour.

name: cappelletti2
description: Cappelletti, aka Aperitivo Cappelletti, is a wine-based Italian red bitter aperitif that"s been produced by the Cappelletti family for four generations.

name: drambuie2
description: Drambuie is a whisky liqueur. A blend of aged Scotch whisky, spices, herbs & heather honey. Its origins can be traced to a secret recipe created for Bonnie Prince Charlie by his Royal Apothecary in the 18th Century.

name: galliano2
description: Galliano L'Autentico is a bright yellow, sweet herbal Italian liqueur. It"s made with a blend of 30 herbs, spices and plant extracts, and was invented in Tuscany, Italy since 1896.

name: limoncello2
description: Limoncello is made with a neutral alcohol: vodka, grappa or rectified spirit (highly concentrated ethanol)
